verses.text: Wine \add is\add* a mocker, strong drink \add is\add* raging: and whoever is deceived by it is not wise.
The fear of a king \add is\add* as the roaring of a lion: \add whoever\add* provoketh him to anger sinneth \add against\add* his own soul.
\add It is\add* an honor for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.
The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; \add therefore\add* shall he beg in harvest, and \add have\add* nothing.
Counsel in the heart of man \add is like\add* deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?
The just \add man\add* walketh in his integrity: his children \add are\add* blessed after him.
A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
Divers weights, \add and\add* divers measures, both of them \add are\add* alike abomination to the LORD.
Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work \add is\add* pure, and whether \add it is\add* right.
The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.
Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thy eyes, \add and\add* thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
\add It is\add* naught, \add it is\add* naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone, then he boasteth.
There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge \add are\add* a precious jewel.
Take his garment that is surety \add for\add* a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
Bread of deceit \add is\add* sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
\add Every\add* purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.
He that goeth about \add as\add* a tale-bearer revealeth secrets; therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
Whoever curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
An inheritance \add may be\add* gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end of it shall not be blessed.
Say not thou, I will recompense evil; \add but\add* wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.
Divers weights \add are\add* an abomination to the LORD; and a false balance \add is\add* not good.
Man's goings \add are\add* of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?
\add It is\add* a snare to the man \add who\add* devoureth \add that which is\add* holy, and after vows to make inquiry.
A wise king scatterreth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.
The spirit of man \add is\add* the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.
Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upheld by mercy.
The glory of young men \add is\add* their strength: and the beauty of old men \add is\add* the gray head.
The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so \add do\add* stripes the inward parts of the belly.
